Perforce File Information Dialog Box

Requires: Professional System

Select Tools»Source Control»Properties from the menu of the front panel or block diagram of a VI to display this dialog box if you are using the Perforce command line interface.

Use this dialog box to obtain a summary of information about the file, including the paths to the file in the Perforce depot and on the client, the type of file, check-out status, and modification dates.

  • Depot Path—Indicates the path to the file within the Perforce depot structure.
  • Client Path—Indicates the path to the file on the local computer.
  • File Type—Indicates the Perforce file type. Typical types are text or binary.
  • Head Revision—Indicates the most recent revision number in the Perforce depot.
  • Have Revision—Indicates the number of the last revision to which you synched.
  • Head Action—Indicates any action that occurred at the head revision, such as add, branch, delete, edit, or integrate.
  • Head Change—Indicates the number of the head revision changelist.
  • Last ModTime—Indicates the date and time when a file change was submitted to the Perforce depot.
  • Opened For—Indicates the users who opened the file from the Perforce depot.
  • Describe—Launches the Perforce Changelist Description dialog box, which displays the details of a numbered changelist you select from the Opened For indicator. If you select a default changelist, Describe is disabled.
  • Locked By—Indicates which user, if any, has opened and locked the file in the Perforce depot.
